page.title: 08LORD THURSO'S LAND
page.content: {Lord Thurso}owns the Ulbster estates which now amounts to about 40,000 acres. The centre of the estate is the {River Thurso}attractive to visiting anglers for salmon and trout fishing. Much of his land is let to tenant farmers but{Lord Thurso}farms a small acreage at{Thurso East Mains}and keeps a small flock of pedigreed Suffolk and crossbred Suffolk sheep there. About 500 acres of the{Thurso East} farm are let to Mr. Morris who rears beef cattle and sheep and grows oats, barley and grass. The farm was previously a dairy farm but because of Common Market 'butter mountains' and 'milk lakes' he now produces beef. The farm cottages are now let mainly as holiday homes. {Lord and Lady Thurso}are well known in the area and spend much time taking part in community activities.
